description: System-generated unique identifier for the attachment record.
Business-facing attachment code or sequence within its parent entity; likely not the primary key—confirm with SME.
Short title or description of the attachment’s content (e.g., manual, photo, diagram).
Location of the attachment file on disk or a network share.
Binary data storing the file contents when the attachment is embedded in the database rather than referenced by path.
Rich Text Format content stored for the attachment when maintained as text instead of a file; confirm usage with SME.
Additional notes or remarks about the attachment.
Flag indicating whether this attachment should appear on printed reports or is allowed to print (1=yes, 0=no).
System-maintained timestamp of the latest change to this record.
Timestamp of the last modification attributed to a user action; naming is ambiguous—confirm with SME.
Identifier of the user who created the attachment record.
Timestamp when the attachment record was created.
Identifier of the user who last modified the attachment.
Timestamp of the most recent user modification.
